description: NBC News filmed the aftermath of a deadly Israeli airstrike on an UNRWA school in northern Gaza where Palestinian families, displaced by the war, were trying to survive. “We are human beings,” said Ahmed Abu Sultan, “For God’s sake. If we can't stay in a school, where do we go?”
title: Gazan civilians bombed while sheltering in U.N. school

description: A 35-year-old woman who sent 8,000 greeting cards in one month to Harry Styles admitted to stalking the pop superstar and was sentenced to 14 weeks behind bars.
title: Woman who sent Harry Styles 8,000 cards in a month sentenced to 14 weeks in jail for stalking

description: Nearly half of China’s major cities are suffering “moderate to severe” levels of subsidence, putting millions of people at risk of flooding, a study found.
title: Nearly half of China’s major cities are sinking, researchers say

description: A substantial number of Indians voted in the first phase of the world's largest election, authorities said, as Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeks a third term on the back of issues such as growth, welfare and Hindu nationalism. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports on India's democratic choice.
title: Almost one billion people start voting in India's general election

description: Apple said on Friday it had removed Meta Platforms’ WhatsApp and Threads from its App Store in China after being ordered to do so by the Chinese government, which cited national security concerns.
title: Apple pulls WhatsApp, Threads from China app store after Beijing order

description: Speaking after a meeting of G7 ministers in Capri, Italy, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken had little to say about Israel's strike on Iran other than to say the U.S. was not involved in any offensive operations and that Washington and its allies were working to de-escalate tensions in the Middle East.
title: U.S. not involved in any offensive operations, Blinken says of Israel's strike on Iran

description: Israel attacked Iran with a limited strike, a move that is threatening to escalate tensions between the two countries. Explosions were reported in the skies of two Iranian cities, Isfahan and Tabriz. NBC News' Raf Sanchez reports on the latest developments in the Israel-Iran conflict.
title: Middle East on edge after Israel launches strike inside Iran

description: Rafael Grossi, director general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, spoke with Sky News' Wilfred Frost in the wake of Israel's strike on Isfahan. “Sky News Today with Wilfred Frost” streams live daily at 5 a.m. ET on NBC News NOW.
title: IAEA chief says Iran could produce a nuclear weapon 'within months'

description: A person familiar with the situation told NBC News that Israel carried out an operation in Iran. Earlier, Israeli officials notified U.S. officials that a response was coming.
title: Israel carries out strike in Iran
